data.title: files and folders not selectable in file tree within additional windows
data.body:
The file tree seems to work fine in the first atom editor window opened. However, the file tree on each successive window is unresponsive and the context menu is also no responsive
![screenshot at feb 15 14-41-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/617927/13059789/4a9cd428-d3f2-11e5-8dcf-883a4ec3d11c.png)
![screenshot at feb 15 14-41-50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/617927/13059790/4aa8eb32-d3f2-11e5-885e-34f33995d60e.png)

The small screenshot is from the first editor window that is opened when the program is first started. The larger one is from the second screen I opened and the file list is, for some reason, not selectable. I can type in the editor portion, I just cannot open a file from the tree view.

I am currently on version 1.5.3, but it has been occurring for the last couple of versions I think it started around version 1.5.0.

If you have any suggestions I would appreciate them. Thanks

data.title: [1.5.3] Markdown editing lags after some time
data.body:
If you open a simple readme.md file and press `ctrl + shift + m` it opens a markdown preview on the right. After editing forth and back **some time** the atom editor gets slower. Moving the windows separator between the preview and the editor gets laggy. Opening folded paragraphs (via # headlines) freezes atom for some time.

I have not tested if not opening the preview does not cause this error.
This was in 1.4.1 already I think. No idea about previous versions.

Edit: has nothing to do with the markdown preview. It just gets slower after editing the file.

data.title: Attempt to fetch package list gives 'bad option: --harmony_collections'
data.body:
Fetching packages fails on Atom 1.5.3 gives:

/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/bin/node: bad option: --harmony_collections

Executing /usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/bin/node -v produces "v5.6.0".
/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/bin/node is a symlink from /usr/bin/node, the Node.js from the distro's repository.

data.title: Error: Cannot find module '../build/Debug/nodegit.node'
data.body:
When launching Atom, I get nothing but what appears to be a Chrome JavaScript error page.
![atom_057](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17238705/13039235/2aa28ec8-d362-11e5-8f61-920eb6bbf178.png)
The error in question is:`Cannot find module '../build/Debug/nodegit.node'`.

I'm unfamiliar with NodeJS, but it appears to me that perhaps there may be an omission in the [build instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md). It looks like I'm missing something that I need, but what is it?

v.1.6.0beta3 built from source on Ubuntu 14.04 32-bit and installed from a self-built .deb, all done according to the instructions.

data.title: Register Atom for file associations in Windows
data.body:
:checkered_flag: Register atom.exe as a file handler for the current user including updating the .exe location on upgrade and removing it on uninstall. 

Addresses #4893 and #6860. Partially addresses #6177 in that we now do the right thing although Cyberduck on Windows still seems to have some issues - I couldn't get Edit With to even work with Notepad although the Open With from the transfer Window now works with Atom.

Tested on Win7/x86 and Win10/x64:
![handlerwin7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/118951/13037228/f82a674e-d330-11e5-8021-692c90937dd6.PNG)
![handlerwin10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/118951/13037220/e420371a-d330-11e5-9d96-260eb4489dfc.png)

data.title: Fixed atom documentation hyperlink
data.body: Changed the atom/link to Atom Documentation

data.title: Errors in scrollbar of treeview
data.body:
Hi,

i'm always getting that messy scrollbar... i am using gnome 3.16 on various machines with mixed intel, amd and nvidia  cards. i noticed that only "this" scrollbar is effected. Size, width, color of it doesnt matter.

(Screenshot was taken with a"Gallium 0.4 on AMD MULLINS (DRM 2.43.0, LLVM 3.6.2)")

![selection_003](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16868514/13030167/24739c98-d2a1-11e5-9e26-990af82707a8.png)

data.title: Missing delete in edit menu
data.body:
Hi,

i an copy, paste, copy path from edit dialog. But if i am viewing a file i cant delete it via that menu... please add an delete option which closes the current tab and deletes the file.

data.title: Improvements on file deletion dialog
data.body:
Hi there,

i would to suggest to add a few improvements to the file deletion dialog.
![atomeitordeletedialog](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16868514/13030065/4576cd64-d29e-11e5-872f-0a4812828373.jpg)

**First:**
if deleting a bunch of files it gets hardly to read... so please put the filenames into a x/y scrollable area.

**Second:**
if I detect a "wrong" filename, i need to cancel the dialog, and search for it in the tree nav... and start deletion again... so please put checkboxes in front of the file name which allows to deselect a file to exclude it from deletion

**Third:**
Add a dialogtitle :) currently the dialog has a blank title bar... 

**Forth:**
The lightbulb indicates a hint... Add an exclamation mark which would indicate a dangerous operation, or a question mark that indicates its a question...

**Fifth:**
Don't switch phrasing... i start the operation with an option that's labelled "delete", i read delete in the dialog text, then i need to "move it to trash" instead of simple "delete" it. Name the button please "Yes, delete" or change wording on action and dialogs. Oh, and i'm about to delete the files... i am not currently deleting them if the dialog is displayed

data.title: Please get Atom added on steam
data.body:
It would be nice to be able to grab Atom off of Steam. It would probably have to go through Steam Greenlight, but it would make it easier to get it downloaded and kept up to date for those of us who use Steam anyway.

https://steamcommunity.com/greenlight/

data.title: Editor extremely slow when a single line has many characters.
data.body:
I was trying to break apart an HTML line that has over 80,000 characters.

This is the line: [Paste](http://pastebin.com/YYeepsCP)

I pasted the line into atom (v1.5.3), and it's being really slow and hard to work with.
Scrolling horizontally sometimes freezes, adding a letter somewhere in the middle is also a big problem.

data.title: Grammar Name Incorrect on `workspace.open`
Unnecessary module loading error triggered
data.body:
I'm developing a [plugin](https://coderoad.github.io) for Atom using React. Since upgrading to Atom 1.5.3 from Atom 1.5.2 I get an error when the package is opened. 

```
Cannot find module 'react'
```

The plugin still runs without issue, React loads fine, but how can I stop the loading error alert from triggering in Atom?


data.title: Beta: change value of "name' in package.json (for wm_class)
data.body:
In linux, the way that the system knows how to group application icons for their application is via the WM_CLASS property that gets set on the X11 window. In electron, this is set by reading the `"name": "atom"` in the package.json.

I'm proposing, that during a build of beta, this gets changed to `"name": "atom-beta".

Related: https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/atom-editor-beta-bin/?comments=all#comment-532582

data.title: Hangs UI when opening large file
data.body: When opening a large (say, a binary) file, the UI hangs while it is being read.

data.title: Trigger event on pane resize
data.body:
I don't believe there currently exists an event when a pane is resized?

If it existed, this would facilitate things like scaling content to fit the pane size, as in izuzak/atom-pdf-view#112.

I'm not sure of the implementation, but I'd suggest this could be added to [PaneResizeHandleElement#resizeStopped](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/8fb4e887df800438b2deeb23a2c23004b9ff358a/src/pane-resize-handle-element.coffee#L28-L31):

``` coffee
resizeStopped: ->
    document.removeEventListener 'mousemove', @resizePane
    document.removeEventListener 'mouseup', @resizeStopped
```

data.title: github crashed
data.body:
got a message saying atom has crashed and
Please report this issue to https://github.com/atom/atom.
i tried to start atom from the terminal and i had recently installed zsh shell and was trying to open the .zshrc file to change the theme of the terminal. how do i fix this?? i am using ubuntu linux and the version of atom is 1.3.3

data.title: Empty folder problem
data.body:

12/02/16 19:58:21,679 Atom[4497]: Cannot read property 'substr' of null
12/02/16 19:58:21,680 Atom[4497]: TypeError: Cannot read property 'substr' of null
    at AtomWindow.module.exports.AtomWindow.getLoadSettings (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/browser/atom-window.js:135:71)

    at emitOne (events.js:82:20)
    at BrowserWindow.emit (events.js:169:7)

It's not working now.

OS X: El Capitan
Atom: 1.5.2
